timeline.bodyText:
Nit, the method name " givenUnitWithSuicideOnHit("type1", false)" is a bit akward with those parameters. I would have expected it to always return a unit with suicide on hit. Boolean parameters are generally evil, so one thing we can do is to create two methods for both cases and that would help with the naming problem. Then it would be:
givenUnitWithTypeNameAndSuicideOnHit("type1")
givenUnitWithTypeNameWithoutSuicideOnHit("type2")

Though, TBH we would do well if we could create a value object out of this and avoid mocks. That makes me think that the API we are testing should accept the property values rather than the actual unit type object.
If we keep the boolean parameter, then perhaps a more descriptive method name would be:
givenUnitWithTypeAndHasSuicideOnHit(...)
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: The givenUnit() methods aren't returning mocks.  They are returning an actual Unit and/or UnitType object.  I've changed them to just return a default UnitType and/or Unit and then set the isSuicideOnHit in the test method itself.
